description.narrative:
The Australia Indonesia Partnership (AIP) Country Strategy 2008-2013 identifies Aceh as one of five priority provinces. Under the new AIP Country Strategy, and in line with the Prime Minister's announcement in June 2008 of $50m for peace and develoment in Aceh over the life of the Strategy, Australia’s program in Aceh will move away from post-tsunami assistance and transition into a post-conflict program focused on local level improvements in government processes, basic services, community participation and creating an enabling environment for economic growth.
The Local Governance Innovations for Communities in Aceh Phase II (LOGICA2) initiative builds on LOGICA, a post-tsunami governance rehabilitation program which aimed to strengthen local capacity to manage the reconstruction process in tsunami-affected areas. LOGICA2 equips communities with skills and knowledge and mentors them to actively advocate for improved services from government. In parallel, LOGICA2 works with governm
